meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Hippo Happy Hour Edition: Octopath Traveler Review!

Hey there, fellow gamers! It's your favorite seasonal grok reviewer here, ready to dish out some juicy insights on the oh-so-rarely-fun JRPGs. And what better way to kick off our Hippo Happy Hour than with Square Enix's latest masterpiece - Octopath Traveler?

Now, before I dive into the game's awesomeness, let me just say that I'm a self-proclaimed JRPG snob. Yep, you heard it right - I only play the classics ( Chrono Trigger , anyone?) and expect nothing but pure, unadulterated nostalgia from any new release. And trust me when I say that Octopath Traveler delivers in spades!

But wait, what about the haters? Ah, yes! Those poor souls who just can't seem to get with the retro vibes (looking at you, GameSpot) or find fault in the game's storytelling (yeah, GamingTrend, we see you). Let me tell you - as a seasoned grok reviewer, I've got my own special brand of snarkiness reserved for those naysayers. And I'll get to them later.

For now, let's focus on the good stuff! Octopath Traveler is an absolute stunner from top to bottom. The game's aesthetic is straight outta a pixelated dream - think Final Fantasy VI meets Chrono Trigger , and you're not far off. But here's the thing: it's not just about the looks (although, oh boy, are they gorgeous!). It's about the gameplay, baby!

And speaking of which, Octopath Traveler 's battle system is pure magic! Think strategic party management, combo attacks galore, and an actual challenge to your reflexes. And don't even get me started on those sweet, sweet cinematic cutscenes - I mean, who needs a movie when you've got a JRPG, amirite?

Now, let's get back to the naysayers. Yeah, I know - some folks might find the storytelling a bit... fragmented (GameSpot, I'm looking at you). Or maybe they just can't connect with the characters (GamingTrend, yeah, we see you again). But here's the thing: for me, Octopath Traveler 's narrative is all about the journey, not the destination. And trust me when I say that each character's unique storyline is more than enough to keep me coming back for more.

In conclusion (for now), Octopath Traveler is an absolute must-play for any JRPG fan looking for a healthy dose of retro charm and modern sensibilities. So go ahead, give it a try - and don't let the haters bring you down! More to come in our next Hippo Happy Hour Edition!

Stay groovy, gamers!
